Package org.dellroad.jct.jshell

Class JShellCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dellroad.jct.core.simple.AbstractSimpleCommand
      • org.dellroad.jct.core.simple.command.SubshellCommand
        • org.dellroad.jct.jshell.JShellCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SimpleCommand
    public class JShellCommand
extends SubshellCommand
    A command that fires up a JShell instance.

    The JShell instance can be customized in two ways:

    • Overriding JShellShell.createBuilder() allows customization of the JavaShellToolBuilder that is used to build new JShell instances. Supply the customized JShellShell instances when constructing instances of this class.
    • Overriding buildJShellParams() allows customization of the flags and parameters passed to JShell itself (these are the same as accepted by the jshell(1) command line tool). By default, the parameters passed are the just parameters given to this command on the command line.

    This implementation also registers an ExecutionControl implementation that is similar to LocalExecutionControl, but delegates to the current thread's context loader as its parent class loader. This fixes issues with finding local classes in certain more complex class loading situations such as running in a web container. Use enableLocalContextExecution() automatically to enable this behavior.

      • buildJShellParams

        protected List<String> buildJShellParams​(List<String> commandLineParams)
        Generate a list of command line flags and parameters to be passed to the JShell tool, given the arguments given on the shell command line for this command.

        If this method is overridden such that this command's parameters are interpreted differently, then the full constructor taking customized help detail should be used.

        The implementation in JShellCommand just returns the list unmodified unless enableLocalContextExecution() has been invoked, in which case the parameters returned by LocalContextExecutionControlProvider.generateJShellFlags(java.lang.ClassLoader) are prepended.

        Parameters:
        commandLineParams - parameters given to the shell command line
        Returns:
        flags and parameters for JShell
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if commandLineParams is null

      • getSourceClassLoader

        protected ClassLoader getSourceClassLoader()
        Choose the ClassLoader that we examine to build the source --class-path when the local class loading workaround is enabled.

        The implementation in JShellCommand always returns null.

        Returns:
        class loader for source compilation, or null to use the current thread's context class loader
        See Also:
        LocalContextExecutionControlProvider.generateJShellFlags(java.lang.ClassLoader)
